case_title: RIAZ HUSSAIN And Others vs Syed MANZOOR HUSSAIN SHAH And OTHER
complaint_summary: The respondent filed an application for partition which was proceeded ex parte against the petitioners by the Assistant Collector, 1st Grade on 9-10-1983 and 8-4-1984. The petitioners sought cancellation of these orders.
investigation_summary: The Assistant Collector, 1st Grade set aside the ex parte orders on 23-7-1988. The respondent appealed to the Collector, who accepted the appeal on 17-1-1990. The petitioners' revision petition was rejected by the Additional Commissioner on 17-3-1991.

final_order.instructions: Original application for review restored before Tehsildar/Assistant Collector, 1st Grade for fresh decision in accordance with law.

Decision_or_verdict: The original application for review is restored before the Assistant Collector, 1st Grade for fresh decision.
legal_arguments: Failure of Tehsildar/Assistant Collector to seek permission from higher authority under section 163(2) of the Land Revenue Act should not penalize petitioners.
Original application for partition included names of deceased co-sharers.
sections: Section 163(2) of the Land Revenue Act
key_issues: Failure to seek higher authority's permission for review
Inclusion of deceased co-sharers in partition application

legal_terms.Ex parte: Proceedings conducted without the presence of one party.

words_and_phrases.Review: Re-examination of a decision by the same or higher authority.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a dispute over partition orders issued ex parte by the Assistant Collector, 1st Grade. The orders were set aside but later reinstated by higher authorities. The court ruled that procedural failures by the Assistant Collector should not penalize the petitioners and restored the application for fresh adjudication.
